alert.note: Alert for Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN, SOUTHERN CAMPBELL, NORTHEASTERN PENDLETON, SOUTHERN CLERMONT AND WEST CENTRAL BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 448 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Neville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Mount Orab, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Felicity, Hamersville, Mentor, Moscow, Neville, California, Chilo, Mount Auburn, Willow Grove, Bradford, Saltair, Gubser Mill, Nicholsville, Peach Grove and Ivor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
